docs.lead_paragraph: BUSH SEES ECONOMIC TEST President Bush, in a shift from his usual economic assessments, told a group of business leaders in Chicago that the nation faced economic challenges because of rising oil prices, the home mortgage crisis and a weakening job market. ''We cannot take growth for granted,'' Mr. Bush acknowledged that many Americans shared his concern about the economy. TAX CUTS, BUT FOR WHOM? Should President Bush become convinced the economy is headed into recession, he is likely to fight it with tax breaks for businesses and people at all income levels and for businesses. But Democratic leaders may have different tax breaks in mind. [C1.]
